CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1953, pg. 12 reads: "Hill City Queen Contest - These 16 charming young girls are vying with each other for the title of "Hill City Queen," by gathering votes from their friends and relatives. No.1: Shirley Smith is leading now with 300 votes.  Others following her are Geraldine Stevens, Shirley Mason, Christine Bundridge, Darlene Casey, Lorraine Pearson, Queenie Satchell and Betty Tate.  Lower row, left to right: Frances Peterson, Marilyn Bryant, Lillie Tolbert, Mary Strother, Ruby Thomas, Sarah Plowden, Lillie Harris, Romaine Parham, and Lorraine Spears.-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Geraldine Stevens, wearing short sleeved corduroy top with light colored trim around collar and cuffs, pleated plaid skirt, and flower shaped pendant, posed in front of light colored background, in Harris Studio for Hill City Queen contest
